title: Margherita Pasta
steps: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
Sauté minced garlic in olive oil until fragrant, then add chopped tomatoes.
Toss the cooked pasta with the tomato mixture and finish with basil and parmesan.
summary: A bright, basil-forward spaghetti that keeps the pantry core intact.

title: Garlic Parmesan Chicken
steps: Pound chicken breasts to even thickness and season with salt and pepper.
Sear in olive oil until golden, then add garlic and cook until aromatic.
Finish with parmesan and fresh basil before serving.
summary: Pan-seared chicken layered with garlic and a fast parmesan finish.

title: Roasted Pepper Spaghetti
steps: Roast sliced red peppers until tender and lightly charred.
Blend peppers with garlic and olive oil to make a quick sauce.
Toss with spaghetti and finish with grated parmesan.
summary: Smoky roasted peppers add depth to a simple spaghetti base.

title: Tomato Basil Bruschetta
steps: Dice tomatoes and onion, then toss with minced garlic and olive oil.
Season with salt and fold in fresh basil before serving on toasted bread.
summary: A no-fuss tomato starter built entirely from pantry staples.

title: Mushroom Parmesan Pasta
steps: Sauté sliced mushrooms in olive oil until browned.
Add garlic and cook briefly before tossing with cooked pasta.
Finish with parmesan and cracked pepper.
summary: Earthy cremini mushrooms give this weeknight pasta extra depth.
